;印度和尼泊尔上周签署了一系列贸易协议，但这可能不会分析人士表示，在边境争端和喜马拉雅内陆国家日益增长的反印度情绪的情况下，这足以使双边关系顺利进行。

;

;南亚邻国在尼泊尔总理期间关闭了一些由印度援助建造的项目Pushpa Kumar Dahal 部长与印度外长 Narendra Modi 的会晤，包括一条连接 Kurthal 和 Bijalpura 的 17.4 公里跨境铁路线。

;

;新德里还批准了一项三边电力交易，据此尼泊尔将能够出口 40兆瓦的电力通过印度输送到孟加拉国。

;

;他们心目中的中国：为什么印尼边界已成为一个导火索

;

;虽然德里提供经济援助的方式是促进关系的一种方式在反印度情绪高涨多年之后，双方都回避了对棘手问题的讨论。分析人士表示，达哈尔的访问并没有解决尼泊尔的许多担忧，尽管总理承诺这将是一次“历史性”访问。

;

;“尼泊尔的优先事项是迅速实施先前商定的项目和协议，解决冲突加德满都南亚研究中心主任 Nishchal Pandey 说：“卡拉帕尼的边界争端和印度帮助 Bhairahawa 国际机场全面投入运营。”

;

;“但是，这次访问破坏了这些主要设施自 1816 年尼泊尔和英属印度签订苏高利条约以来，两国一直在争夺对卡拉帕尼地区的控制权，该条约同意卡利河将形成尼泊尔的西部边界。双方未能就这条河流的源头达成一致，其位置——位于中国、印度和尼泊尔的三国交界处——使问题复杂化。

;

;虽然两国领导人在会谈中都提到了争端，但没有解决的迹象。访问结束后，据报道，达哈尔在尼泊尔议会坚称，他曾告诉莫迪，在边界争端得到解决之前，“尼泊尔和印度之间的关系不会恢复正常”。

;

;另一位驻加德满都的分析人士说不愿透露姓名的反对党称，达哈尔的访问“平淡无奇”，前总理 KP 夏尔马·奥利 (KP Sharma Oli) 称达哈尔“未能与印度对话”。然而，这位分析师指出，贸易协议对尼泊尔起到了推动作用。

;

;贾瓦哈拉尔尼赫鲁大学内亚研究中心国际研究学院教授 Sangeeta Thapliyal 也表达了同样的看法，她说，这次访问成功地为两国带来了切实的目标。

;

;“两国都强调基础设施和交通连接，这将进一步加强跨境连接，”她说。 “[这些项目] 将巩固次区域经济发展和经济相互依存的举措。”

;

;

;

;达哈尔为期四天的访问是在新成立的印度议会的一幅有争议的壁画几天后进行的建筑在加德满都引起了愤怒。

;

;这幅壁画旨在描绘古印度，还包括具有历史价值的尼泊尔古镇，如蓝毗尼和迦毗罗卫城，引发了尼泊尔​​政党的强烈反对。这场争吵还可能重新点燃长达数十年的边界争端。

;

;然而，印度外交部发言人表示，达哈尔并未向莫迪提出壁画问题。

;

;壁画这是导致双边关系恶化的一系列事件中的最新一起。

;

;2015 年，德里支持的一项未宣布的“封锁”——表面上是对起草尼泊尔宪法时没有如愿以偿感到恼火——使尼泊尔人离开了五个月来都在为必需品苦苦挣扎。

;

;2020 年，在前领导人奥利的领导下，尼泊尔发布了新地图，声称有争议的领土（包括卡拉帕尼地区）是尼泊尔的领土，这激怒了印度。

;

;随着尼泊尔获得左翼总理，中国的一带一路项目将获得“势头”

;

;印度削减尼泊尔廓尔喀士兵服役年限的举措也激起了加德满都的愤怒。根据去年 6 月推出的 Agnipath 计划，廓尔喀人现在只能在印度军队服役四年，而历史上他们服役的时间要长得多。

;

;对廓尔喀士兵生计的担忧导致尼泊尔政府要求印度停止招募尼泊尔廓尔喀人加入印度军队。

;

;印度外交大臣 Vinay Mohan Kwatra 表示，达哈尔-莫迪会谈涵盖了双边合作的方方面面，包括政治、经济、贸易和发展伙伴关系。他说，没有讨论 Agnipath 计划。

;

;达哈尔长期以来被印度视为亲中国，他本人与德里保持关系的历史曲折。 2008 年，他作为总理首次出访时访问了中国而不是印度，打破了一个不成文的传统。在他第三次担任总理期间，达哈尔确实将德里作为他的第一个停靠港，尽管距去年 12 月上任几个月后。

;

;然而，周四，达哈尔和莫迪都谈到了密切的双边关系在德里的海得拉巴之家。

;

;达哈尔称印度为“近邻和重要伙伴”，称双边关系“由来已久且多方面”。莫迪回应了这种情绪：“我们将继续努力将我们的关系提升到喜马拉雅山的高度。”

;

;关于边界争端，达哈尔说他已于周四与莫迪讨论了这个问题。 “我敦促莫迪总理通过既定的双边外交机制解决边界问题，”他说。

;

;莫迪方面表示，印度将努力“解决所有问题，包括边界问题”。

;

;

;

;虽然中国没有出现在讨论议程上，但最近发生的事件会让德里保持警惕。

;

;达哈尔之行是在加德满都的当地报道中出现的声称尼泊尔军队正计划从中国供应商 Norinco 采购防御装备，包括装甲运兵车和步枪。

;

;虽然军方驳斥了这些报道，但印度肯定注意到了这一点。

;

;德里还担心中国人民解放军可能采取行动将尼泊尔廓尔喀士兵纳入其军队，这是 Agnipath 计划的后果。

;

;美国和印度是否会从中受益尼泊尔最近的政治转变是以中国为代价的？

;

;上周，在加德满都由中国援助建造的重建医院的交接仪式上，达哈尔赞扬了尼泊尔与中国的关系，他说这种关系“可以追溯到远古时代” .

;

;Pandey 表示，虽然德里试图通过提供发展援助来赢得 Dahal，但对于密切关注此次旅行的尼泊尔人来说，这可能还不够。

;

;“[Dahal ] 在他离开之前说这将是一次‘历史性’访问，从而提高了尼泊尔公众的期望，”潘迪说。

;

;“[公众和知识分子过度阅读了这一声明，并期待比最终出现的要多。”

;香港建筑工会呼吁政府带头给予工人更多在炎热的日子里完成任务的时间，说由于时间紧迫，许多人无法按照该市新的防暑指南的建议休息。

;

;周三，一名建筑工人去世后，行业代表提出了他们的呼吁上周发出琥珀色热应激警告期间，他们被发现在中国大学工地的脚手架上失去知觉，引发了人们对上个月出台的指南有效性的质疑。

;

;在三级警告系统下，工人们被告知根据分类的劳动强度水平暂停工作或休息 15 至 45 分钟。

;

;香港建筑工人在黄热警告期间昏迷不醒

;

;“问题港九竹棚架工人工会（东景）主席何炳德说：

;

;香港建造业总工会主席黄炳表示，应该给工人大约六到七天的时间来完成一层楼。

;

;许多人认为Wong 补充说，压力很大，甚至在需要时也经常选择不休息，因为承包商无法忍受最后期限的延迟。

;

;他说他的工会希望房屋委员会通过延长最后期限发挥主导作用

;

;邮报已联系当局征求意见。

;

;刘志文，职业安全香港建造业文书、管理及专业雇员协会的卫生主任表示，某些类型的建筑工作（例如抹灰泥）需要不间断地连续工作，因为混合材料很容易变干。

;

;有工会领袖警告说，天文台上周五在 20 分钟内发出和取消黄色信号时，新的警报系统“非常混乱”。

;

;“我应该如何让工人知道？当我走到工地的另一边时，信号又消失了，”Ho 说，并补充说上周气温飙升至 37 摄氏度时，至少有三名工人中暑。

;

;是否对香港新的高温预警系统感到焦躁不安？邮报给出了答案

;

;虽然一些雇主表示他们已经在群组消息中警告工人注意警报，但 Wong 指出，一些建筑工地完全脱离电网，并不是每个人都随身携带手机。

;

;“我们只能指望其他工人大声说有警报并互相帮助，”他说。

;

;行业代表敦促当局审查他们的预防指南工作中的高温压力。

;

;香港户外工作者在第一个黄色高温警告信号后感到困惑

;

;而不是推出所谓的“一刀切”的休息时间指南，他们补充说，政府应该加紧努力，确保工人拥有必要的设备来帮助他们降温。

;

;警方称，这名 66 岁的建筑工人在修理窗户时死亡上周的黄色信号，是自 5 月中旬引入该指南以来的第一起致命事故。

;

;虽然该指南不具约束力，但劳工及福利局局长孙玉涵早些时候表示，当局已不排除检控多次不遵从检查建议的雇主。

;

;总工会维权及投诉主任吴伟良表示，与死者亲属有联络提供帮助并协商赔偿。

;

;他说，如果尸检报告发现该男子死于中暑，该指南可以作为其亲属的支持性法律参考。

;

;邮报已联系中国大学征求意见。

;前副总统迈克·彭斯宣布，“不同的时代需要不同的领导”他正在挑战他的前老板唐纳德特朗普，争取 2024 年共和党总统候选人提名。

;

;“今天，我们的党和我们的国家需要一位领导人，正如林肯所说，能够吸引更好的天使我们的本性，”彭斯周三在爱荷华州举行的启动活动前发布的一段视频中宣称，爱荷华州拥有全国首个共和党预选会议，也是他集中竞选的地方。

;

;“旁观很容易，但我不是这样长大的，”彭斯在视频中说。 “这就是为什么今天，我要在上帝和我的家人面前宣布我要竞选美国总统。”

;

;这位前印第安纳州国会议员和州长加入了拥挤的共和党名单，其中有 10 多个候选人仍在增加，北达科他州州长 Doug Burgum 也有望在周三宣布参选。

;

;彭斯周三迎来 64 岁生日，他没有在视频中点名特朗普，并辩称美国陷入困境是因为“拜登总统和激进的左派在国内外削弱了美国。”他说，国家面临的威胁包括通货膨胀、迫在眉睫的经济衰退和“被围困”的美国南部边境。

;

;美国人民总是勇敢地迎接挑战，”彭斯在视频中说。 “我们会再一次，我们只需要像我们的人民一样好的政府来做到这一点。”

;

;他将竞选活动的重点放在爱荷华州，他希望在那里与福音派选民和爱荷华州的中西部同胞建立联系。他将从周三在得梅因附近的一场活动开始。

;

;支持彭斯的超级政治行动委员会联合主席斯科特·里德上个月告诉记者，“我们将组织爱荷华州的所有 99 个县，就像我们要让他竞选县治安官一样。”

;

;这位前副总统声称自己是该领域唯一能够赢得共和党提名、击败拜登并以更文明的方式执政的传统保守派

;

;他唤起了罗纳德·里根总统的记忆，他说里根“呼吁美国人恢复乐观，再次相信自己，相信彼此。”

;

;作为特朗普的副总统，彭斯的忠诚度被批评者称为阿谀奉承。 1 月 6 日的叛乱期间出现了一个转折点，当时他拒绝了特朗普拒绝选举团投票给拜登的要求。彭斯表示他没有宪法授权，这促使冲进美国国会大厦的暴民中的一些人高喊“绞死迈克彭斯”。

;

;迈克彭斯必须在 1 月 6 日大陪审团前作证，美国法官规定< /h3>;

;鉴于彭斯迄今未能赢得特朗普的铁杆支持者和寻求替代方案的共和党人的支持，批评者质疑彭斯是否有一条可行的初选之路。尽管他的名字几乎得到了普遍认可，但他尚未在早期投票中脱颖而出。

;

;“我祝他好运，”特朗普周一在接受电台主持人采访时说托德·斯塔恩斯。 “他是个好人。直到最后，我们的关系都非常好。”

;

;彭斯承诺恢复他所谓的深受共和党选民欢迎的“特朗普-彭斯政府”的政策，同时打破他以前的竞选就选举否决主义和其他问题，包括是否对社会保障和医疗保险做出改变。

; Wed, 07 Jun 2023 18:50:02 +0800 Shenzhen’s central business district offers chip-making incentives, with millions in subsidies for new projectshttps://www.scmp.com/tech/tech-trends/article/3223252/shenzhens-central-business-district-offers-chip-making-incentives-millions-subsidies-new-projects?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.06.07 18:30;

;中国南部科技中心深圳的中央商务区宣布了新措施作为中央政府在与美国的竞争不断升级的情况下追求技术自给自足的一部分，支持半导体公司提供从更便宜的租金到价值高达 1000 万元人民币（140 万美元）的现金补贴。

;

;根据周二发布的一份政策文件，位于香港边界的福田区正在为新的半导体公司提供高达 60% 的政府物业市场租金优惠。对于向私人房东租赁的企业，政府可负担一半租金或提供每年最高800万元的补贴，为期三年。

;

;该计划下的现金援助涵盖半导体供应的多个领域链，包括芯片设计、测试和流片，设计过程的最终结果意味着集成电路已准备好投入生产。

;

;中国科技中心深圳推动了增加 AI 计算资源的行动计划

;

;其中一项规定，首次实现全掩模流片的企业，可获得与流片相关研发费用30%或最高1000万元的补贴。它还为从事多项目晶圆服务流片的公司提供 20% 或最高 200 万元的奖励，这些服务允许在单个晶圆上生产来自多个客户的设计。

;

;开发电子产品的公司设计自动化工具或其他知识产权（IP），例如可以授权给其他公司的设计，可以获得最高 500 万元的补贴。购买此类材料的公司也有资格获得补贴，覆盖这些成本的 20% 或最高 300 万元。

;

;深圳市政府认为开发或支持“核心技术突破”的芯片项目也有资格最高 300 万元的补贴。

;

;促进本地半导体生产是福田新计划的一部分，该计划支持中央政府确定的“战略性新兴产业”，其中包括生物制药和信息技术服务.

;

;然而，随着华盛顿稳步增加对先进芯片和芯片制造设备的出口限制，半导体已成为一个特别的热点。

;

;为响应北京实现自给自足的号召在该行业，地方政府加倍努力提供现金激励和其他类型的政策支持以发展本土半导体。

;

;深圳市政府此前宣布了加强芯片价值链的政策，其中包括每年向本地芯片设计公司提供 1000 万元的补贴，以获取其研究所需的核心 IP。

;

;附近的广东省省会广州已投资 2000 亿元帮助刺激半导体、可再生能源领域的活动能源和其他高科技领域。

;

;据广东省副省长王曦介绍，广东省正在建设或规划的主要半导体项目约有 40 个，总投资额超过 5000 亿元。

; p>;

;

;

;该女子于 6 月 2 日在河北省石家庄市的街道上发现这对夫妇，并开始争吵。

;

;随后，丈夫发动车子开车离去，拖着扶着车边的妻子，沿路行驶了约20米，路人才反应过来。 Owl Video 报道了她的帮助。

;在网上分享的一段事件视频中，可以看到这对夫妇的女儿和儿子在车后追赶他们的母亲。

;无论是女人，还是她的丈夫

;

;被迫将车靠边停车的丈夫面对行人，行人对他的鲁莽驾驶感到愤怒。事发时，女子一把揪住丈夫女友的头发，扇了她一巴掌，让丈夫报警。

;

;丈夫随后让妻子上车回家私下商量，她坚决拒绝。

;

;“我们去警局再说吧。如果我和你一起回家，你会打我的。你不觉得你把我打够了吗？”他的妻子说。

;

;“你为了这个女人打了我这么多次，”妻子补充道，然后又打了他女朋友的脸。

;

;然后妻子开始哭泣，对丈夫吼道：“我白天上班，晚上还摆地摊。我为什么这么努力？你一分钱都没给我这辆车是我出钱买的。所以我赚了钱来帮你养小三？”

;“不要松开你的手，姐姐，”一位女士对她喊道。

;“你是男人吗？你不要脸！”人群中一名男子在视频中说。

;民警赶到后，丈夫承诺会给夫妻俩的房子、车子并将两个孩子的监护权交给他的妻子，并提出离婚。

;

;当地警方仍在调查此案，目前尚未就此事件对任何人提出指控，报道称。< /p>;

;

;如果没有那些好心的路人，她的两个孩子会怎样？”

;

;一人说。

;

;另一人评论说：“要不是有一群人围观争吵，站在妻子这边，男人肯定会像往常一样打她。”听她说自己努力养家，他不给钱，拿她的钱搞婚外情，我很同情这个妻子。”

;Pope Francis will undergo an operation for an abdominal hernia on Wednesday at a Rome hospital, where he is expected to stay for “several days”, the Vatican said.

;

;The 86-year-old pope, who underwent surgery in 2021 to have 33 centimetres (13 inches) of his colon removed due to inflammation and narrowing of the large intestine, is suffering from a hernia which is “causing recurrent, painful and worsening” symptoms, Vatican spokesman Matteo Bruni said in a statement.

;

;It followed a brief visit by the pope to the Gemelli hospital in Rome on Tuesday, during which the Vatican said he underwent “clinical tests”.

;

;Francis led his weekly general audience as usual on Wednesday, before preparing to head to the Gemelli.

;

;“In the early afternoon he will undergo a laparotomy and abdominal wall surgery … under general anaesthesia,” Bruni said.

;

;A laparotomy is a surgical incision into the abdominal cavity.

;

;“The stay at the health facility will last several days to allow the normal post-operative course and full functional recovery,” the Vatican said.

;

;Francis, who has been the leader of the world's 1.3 billion Catholics for a decade, has suffered increasing health issues over the past year.

;

;Pope Francis allows women to vote at coming bishops' meeting

;

;In July 2021 he underwent surgery at Gemelli for a type of diverticulitis, an inflammation of pockets that develop in the lining of the intestine.

;

;He was discharged after 10 days.

;

;Francis was also hospitalised for three nights at the end of March with bronchitis, which was cured with antibiotics.

;

;He also has persistent pain in his right knee as well as sciatica.

;

;The pope's hospital stays have always sparked concern and fuelled speculation over his future.

;

;Francis' predecessor, Benedict XVI, who died in December, quit in 2013 due to failing health.

;

;For about a year, the pope has had to rely on a wheelchair due to the recurring knee pain he has said cannot be treated through surgery.

;

;Asked about his health in an interview with US Spanish-language network Telemundo broadcast in May, Francis said it was “much better”.

;

;“I can walk now. My knee has been mending. I could hardly walk beforehand. Now I can. Some days are more painful than others,” the pope said.

;

;Francis added that doctors had caught his bronchitis infection just in time.

;

;“If we'd waited a few more hours, it would've been much more serious. But I was out [of hospital] in four days,” he said.

;

;Despite his health issues, Francis continues to travel widely.

;

;The Vatican has recently confirmed a travel-filled August, when the Holy See and Italy are usually on holiday, with a four-day visit to Portugal the first week of August and a similarly long trip to Mongolia starting August 31.

;

;Pope Francis complains about unfounded accusations against John Paul II

;

;But the pope acknowledged in July 2022 that he needed to slow down.

;

;“At my age and with this limitation, I have to save myself a little bit to be able to serve the Church,” he said then.

;

;“Or, alternatively, to think about the possibility of stepping aside.”

;

;In March, however, he insisted that he had no current plans to quit.

;

;Benedict XVI, who died on December 31 aged 95, surprised the world in 2013 when he announced he was stepping down, a radical move not taken by a pope since the Middle Ages.

;Hong Kong police have arrested a former district council member allegedly recruited by a fraud syndicate to collect HK$970,000 (US$123,689) from nine elderly victims of phone scams in about a week.

;

;Wong Chun-yeung, 28, former Islands district councillor from the opposition camp, was arrested in Tseung Kwan O on Monday after an investigation found he had collected HK$300,000 from a 90-year-old woman who fell victim to a “guess-who-I-am” phone scam, the Post has learned.

;

;The victim, who lives in the Kwun Tong district, fell for the scam when she received a telephone call on Tuesday last week.

;

;Hong Kong police warn of surge in investment scams offering mainland Chinese stocks

;

;“The caller impersonated her son and claimed he was detained over a criminal case and needed HK$300,000 as bail money for his release,” senior inspector Ng Ming-fung of Kwun Tong district crime squad said on Wednesday.

;

;She was told her son's friend would collect the money from her flat. On the same day, Wong allegedly went to her Kwun Tong flat to pick up the cash.

;

;The woman realised she had been conned when she contacted her family and found her son safe. A report was then made to police on the same day.

;

;After an investigation, police arrested Wong in Tseung Kwan O on Monday night. He was detained on suspicion of obtaining property by deception – an offence punishable by up to 10 years in jail.

;

;Delete encrypted messaging apps from kids' phones, police in China tell parents

;

;Without identifying the suspect, the senior inspector said the investigation linked the man to eight cases in which women aged from 71 to 93 fell victim to “guess-who-I-am” phone scams between May 29 and Monday.

;

;“The investigation found the man was allegedly deployed to collect a total of HK$670,000 from the eight elderly women,” Ng said.

;

;He warned that the fraud syndicate placed advertisements on the internet to recruit debt collectors with the offer of a daily wage ranging from HK$1,000 to HK$1,500, but in fact, they were paid to pick up money from scam victims.

;

;Police said the investigation was continuing, and further arrests were possible.

;

;Easy money or costly scam? Why you should ignore bogus job messages on WhatsApp

;

;As of Wednesday afternoon, the man was still being held for questioning.

;

;In October 2021, Wong was among 16 district councillors ousted from office when authorities invalidated their oaths.

;

;In the “guess-who-I-am” phone scam, fraudsters will call victims and ask them to guess their identity. Once the target mentions a name, the tricksters then pretend to be that person and ask for money.

;

;The ruse is one of the three most common phone scams in the city, with the other two involving swindlers pretending to be officials or kidnappers.

; Wed, 07 Jun 2023 17:20:01 +0800 Most Europeans would want to stay neutral in a US-China war over Taiwan, study findshttps://www.scmp.com/news/china/diplomacy/article/3223256/most-europeans-would-want-stay-neutral-us-china-war-over-taiwan-study-finds?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.06.07 17:00;

;A majority of Europeans would prefer their countries to stay neutral if the United States and China go to war over Taiwan, a new study has revealed.

;

;Just 23 per cent of people across 11 countries would want to take the US' side, with 62 per cent wanting to stay neutral.

;

;The poll was part of a study by the European Council on Foreign Relations, which shows that many European citizens (43 per cent) continue to view China as a necessary partner with whom they would like to cooperate – more than any other category.

;

;“European citizens aspire to remain neutral in a US-China conflict and are reluctant to de-risk from China – even if they recognise some risks in China's economic presence in Europe,” the researchers wrote.

;

;The study comes amid a lively debate about how the European Union should engage with China.

;

;In Brussels, policymakers are putting together an economic security strategy, to be proposed on June 20, which will recommend ways of weaning the European economy off Beijing in areas where dependencies are mounting. It will advance the bloc's first moves in screening companies' investments into China, a controversial move that has riled businesses and some member states who want to continue trading freely.

;

;As early as this week, the EU could also agree its first sanctions on Chinese firms for selling banned European hi-tech goods to Russian military buyers.

;

;US officials warn of danger as China rebuffs crisis communication efforts

;

;In some quarters, the China debate has been boiled down to a straight up shoot-out between French President Emmanuel Macron – an advocate of engagement – and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen, the architect of Brussels' “de-risking” campaign.

;

;In April, speaking to media on a flight from Beijing to Guangzhou, Macron said the EU should avoid becoming a “vassal” of the United States on China, especially urging distance concerning any potential military defence of Taiwan.

;

;The remarks sparked a huge discussion in Europe, with Macron roundly criticised by some other EU leaders and a host of US lawmakers. “Some Western leaders dream of cooperation with everyone, with Russia and with some powers in the Far East,” Polish Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki said at the time.

;

;But the research shows that he had his finger on the electoral pulse. French respondents were slightly more willing to support the US than the average European, but 53 per cent preferred to remain neutral.

;

;In Poland, meanwhile, 51 per cent of respondents wanted to stay neutral, even though more Poles were willing to take the US' side than any other nation apart from Sweden.

;

;“The findings show that, in many ways, European citizens are more on Team Macron than Team von der Leyen,” the researchers wrote.

;

;“They do not see China as a power that challenges and wants to undermine Europe, and they do not buy into the 'democracy versus autocracy' framework promoted by the Biden administration.”

;

;Despite 'no limits' ties, China has moved carefully on Russian energy

;

;However, Europeans are increasingly cynical towards China on a number of fronts, the data show.

;

;More Europeans support sanctioning China if it provides Russia with weapons even if it seriously harms Western economies, with 41 per cent in support of such a move versus 33 per cent against. Such a move has been described by EU leaders as a “red line”, and they continue to lobby China to not ship weaponry to the Russian military. Respondents see Russia as an increasingly junior partner in its relationship with China.

;

;They are also wary of Chinese investments in Europe: a large majority thought it “unacceptable” that Chinese companies would own European ports, bridges, newspapers, football teams or technology companies. A smaller majority did not want Chinese companies building key infrastructure.

;

;The study was based on a public opinion poll of 16,168 people in Austria, Bulgaria, Denmark, France, Germany, Hungary, Italy, the Netherlands, Poland, Spain and Sweden. It took place in April.
